title: Are Democrats poised to take back Congress?
shortDescription: Early races suggest Democrats could regain ground. What it means for Trump and the fight for control of Congress.

title: Trump on Iran: 'Sometimes you have to' use force
shortDescription: When asked about Iran, President Donald Trump told reporters that he'd rather not use force, but "sometimes you have to."

title: Trump Media explores Truth Social spin-off after TAE merger
shortDescription: Trump Media & Technology Group said it's exploring spinning off Truth Social into a separate publicly traded company.

title: Trump eyes 'friendly takeover of Cuba'
shortDescription: "We could very well end up having a friendly takeover of Cuba," Trump told reporters Feb. 27.

title: How Epstein depositions affect Clintons, Democrats
shortDescription: Younger congressional Democrats wanted to send a message of political neutrality as the Clintons testified about their ties to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Trump says US may have 'friendly takeover of Cuba'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said Cuba is "in a big deal of" financial trouble. He floated a "friendly takeover" of the Caribbean nation.

title: Trump's State of the Union divided Congress
shortDescription: President Donald Trump longest-ever State of the Union address emphasize what he called economic strength, lower drug prices.

title: It's Bill Clinton's turn to give testimony on Epstein. See age, photos

title: Bill Clinton testifies in Epstein deposition: 'I did nothing wrong'
shortDescription: Bill Clinton told a House panel he 'did nothing wrong' with accused sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein despite numerous mentions in federal files.

title: Warnock says FBI raid was 'pretext' for Trump interference in midterms
shortDescription: Georgia Senator Raphael Warnock said in a spotlight hearing that the FBI raids in Fulton County were a "pretext" for Trump's interference in midterms.

title: Trump tanks in new poll as Vance and Newsom take 2028 lead
shortDescription: President Trump's disapproval rating climbs to 55%, while Gavin Newsom and JD Vance take early leads in 2028 race, new Emerson College poll shows.

title: Bill Gates apologized and Larry Summers forced to resign this week | The Excerpt

title: 'TODAY': Trump's Israel ambassador eyes staff exodus over Iran fears
shortDescription: U.S. ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee told embassy staff who want to leave they "should do so TODAY," amid concern about a possible Iran conflict.
